page.title: 17The Hundleby Hotel.
page.content: The Hundleby Hotel was built at sometime in the l9th century. It started life as an inn called The Maltster Arms. Outside the inn there was a cobbled court yard with stables and coach houses. These have now been demolished and three houses stand in their place. In l872 and for several years after there was a yearly feast at the Maltster Arms. There was home made amusements such as egg racing, dog and rabbit racing. It is reported that there used to be several tramps who would sit on the step shouting out for drink but unable to pay. In the end, the landlord always took a pint of beer out to them to keep them quiet. The Hundleby now has 8 rooms to let and a staff of 4 people.
